name: Taj Mahal
history: Built by Shah Jahan for Mumtaz Mahal in the 17th century.
significance: UNESCO World Heritage Site; symbol of love.

name: Gateway of India
history: Erected to commemorate the landing of King George V in 1911.
significance: Iconic monument overlooking the Arabian Sea.

name: India Gate
history: War memorial dedicated to soldiers of the British Indian Army.
significance: Popular public space and national landmark.

name: Hawa Mahal
history: Built in 1799 with 953 jharokhas for royal women.

name: Charminar
history: Built in 1591 by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah.
significance: Symbol of Hyderabad and Indo-Islamic architecture.

name: Victoria Memorial
history: Dedicated to Queen Victoria; built between 1906 and 1921.
significance: Museum and gardens with colonial architecture.
